Step-By-Step Skinning Example

Here is a list of the steps one has to make in order to style RadChart to look like the image we used when describing the Chart elements. We start with a plain chart with no visual properties defined.

  1. Styling the chart’s borders and background

  2. Appearance -> Appearance -> Border -> Color : 0; 66; 110

  3. Appearance -> Appearance -> Border -> Width : 5

  4. Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> FillType : Gradient

  5. Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> FillSettings -> GradientMode : Center

  6. Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : 35; 189; 254

  7. Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> SecondColor : 26; 120; 179

  8.  

  9. Styling the title

  10. Elements -> ChartTitle -> Appearance -> Border -> Visible : False

  11. Elements -> ChartTitle -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : None / Transparent

  12. Elements -> ChartTitle -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White

  13. Elements -> ChartTitle -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> TextProperties -> Font : Verdana; 14pt

  14. Elements -> ChartTitle -> Appearance ->Position -> AlignedPosition : TopLeft

  15. Elements -> ChartTitle -> Appearance -> Dimensions -> Margins : 4%; 10px; 14px; 8%

  16. Styling the legend

  17. Elements -> Legend -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : None / Transparent

  18. Elements -> Legend -> Appearance -> Border -> Visible : False

  19. Elements -> Legend -> Appearance -> ItemTextAppearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White

  20. Elements -> Legend -> TextBlock -> Text : Legend

  21. Elements -> Legend -> TextBlock -> Visible : True

  22. Elements -> Legend -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> TextProperties -> Color : LightSkyBlue

  23. Elements -> Legend -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> Position -> AlignedPosition : Top

  24. Elements -> Legend -> Appearance -> Position -> AlignedPosition -> BottomRight

  25. Elements -> Legend -> Appearance -> Dimensions -> Margins : 1px; 3%; 12%; 1px

  26. Styling the plot area

  27. Elements -> PlotArea -> Appearance -> Border -> Color : 97; 180; 223

  28. Elements -> PlotArea -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : 50; 255; 255; 255

  29. Elements -> PlotArea -> Appearance -> Dimensions -> Margins : 18%; 90px; 15%; 10%

  30. Styling the X Axis

  31. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> Appearance -> Color : 96; 164; 205

  32. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> Appearance -> MajorGridLines -> Color : 120; 209; 248

  33. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> Appearance -> MajorTick -> Color : 96; 164; 205

  34. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> Appearance -> TextAppearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White

  35. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> AxisLabel -> TextBlock -> Text -> X Axis

  36. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> AxisLabel -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> TextProperties -> Color : LightSkyBlue

  37. Elements -> PlotArea -> XAxis -> AxisLabel -> Appearance -> Dimensions -> Paddings : 1px; 1px; 10%; 1px

  38. Styling the Y Axis

  39. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> Color : 95; 165; 208

  40. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> MajorGridLines -> Color : 120; 209; 248

  41. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> MajorTick -> Color : 95; 165; 208

  42. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> MajorGridLines -> Color : 120; 209; 248

  43. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> MinorTick -> Color : 95; 165; 208

  44. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> Appearance -> TextAppearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White

  45. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> AxisLabel -> TextBlock -> Text -> Y Axis

  46. Elements -> PlotArea -> YAxis -> AxisLabel -> TextBlock -> Appearance -> TextProperties -> Color : LightSkyBlue

  47. Styling the data series

  48. Data -> Series -> Series 1 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> Border -> Color : 153; 209; 248

  49. Data -> Series -> Series 1 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : 213; 247; 255

  50. Data -> Series -> Series 1 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> SecondColor : 157; 217; 238

  51. Data -> Series -> Series 1 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> TextAppearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White

  52. Data -> Series -> Series 2 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> Border -> Color : 67; 181; 229

  53. Data -> Series -> Series 2 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> MainColor : 136; 221; 246

  54. Data -> Series -> Series 2 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> FillStyle -> SecondColor : 59; 161; 197

  55. Data -> Series -> Series 2 -> Appearance -> Appearance -> TextAppearance -> TextProperties -> Color : White
